intro: Benthamia glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth benthamia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, silky hair, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Benthamia glaberrima is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
